name: California
description: California offers a comprehensive medical card program for eligible residents. The state requires applicants to be at least 18 years old and have a qualifying medical condition as determined by a licensed physician.

name: New York
description: New York's medical card program provides access to certified dispensaries throughout the state. Applicants must be 21 or older and have documentation from a registered healthcare provider.

name: Florida
description: Florida's medical marijuana program requires patients to be registered with the state and have a qualifying medical condition. The minimum age is 18, though minors can qualify with parental consent.

name: Texas
description: Texas operates a limited medical program called the Compassionate Use Program. Eligible patients must be 18 or older and have specific qualifying conditions as defined by state law.

name: Colorado
description: Colorado was one of the first states to establish a medical marijuana program. Patients must be 18 or older and have a debilitating medical condition as certified by a physician.

name: Arizona
description: Arizona's medical marijuana program serves patients with qualifying medical conditions. The application fee is $150 and applicants must be at least 18 years old with valid physician certification.

name: Massachusetts
description: Massachusetts offers a medical marijuana program for patients with qualifying conditions. Registration requires being 18 or older and having a written certification from a registered healthcare provider.

name: Washington
description: Washington State provides medical marijuana access to qualified patients. There is no fee for registration, and applicants must be at least 18 years old with a valid medical authorization.

name: Oregon
description: Oregon's Medical Marijuana Program requires patients to be 18 or older and have a qualifying medical condition. The annual registration fee is $200, with reduced fees available for qualifying individuals.

name: Nevada
description: Nevada's medical marijuana program allows qualified patients to access dispensaries statewide. Applicants must be Nevada residents, at least 18 years old, and have physician certification.
